verbose_text: TheMEFV gene, encoding the pyrin protein, is preferably expressed in granulocytes and is thought to inhibit excess inflammation induced by these cells.4 Koc et al reported that a higher frequency of MEFV gene mutation carriers has been observed among critically ill patients with pneumonia, UTIs, and acute pancreatitis in Turkey.12 Ben-Chetrit et al also reported that there are patients with MEFV mutations that exhibit distinct clinical presentations not typical of FMF.13 Thus, patients with the MEFV gene show symptoms, due to the disturbed immune response, except for periodic fever.
evidence: TheMEFV gene, encoding the pyrin protein, is preferably expressed
